channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Montrave Road public bin completely full and needs emptying, 7th January

Montrave Road public bin completely full and needs emptying

item.title: No lighting, 7th January
item.description:
Have reported previously. Apparently nobody knows where to locate power source. There is 12 car park lights and another 3 that light the children's playground. Also the lights to the entrance of 179-285 Frances st been out for months. Block and car park and play area in complete darkness. No resolution from Greenwich. Problems with ansociail behaviour and drug use. Community police have been great. Greenwich rubbish over a year bo resolution.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Frances Street, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant inconsiderate parking, 7th January
item.description:
Parking is very limited, but the same car is constantly taking up 2 spaces with 1 car despite numerous friendly conversations. It’s getting to a point where we are having to block in other residents to be able to park because this same grey Audi doesn’t know how to park his car. As a suggestion, could we potentially look into making the car park residents only by means of permit or gate installation, or at a minimum installing parking bay lines to clearly outline where to park. The parking area usually fits 6 vehicles however due to the inconsiderate parking of the Audi on a daily basis we can only fit 4 vehicles. The carpark in question is at 357-367 Plumstead high street SE181JX, the entrance to the carpark is via woodhurst road.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woodhurst Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road wear and tear between road and pavement, 7th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bevington Road, Beckenham, Greater London

item.title: Black, 7th January
item.description:
Pavements not gritted around junction or any side roads leading to Oakhurst causing members of public to fall. Witnessed four separate members of the public fall over, one pregnant and one elderly with a dog. Witnessed lady on bicycle fall and injure hip, resulting in her going to hospital. Members of public were forced to walk in the road to avoid ungritted areas. Very dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Upland Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Just outside 2 Cavendish Road /see photo/, 7th January
item.description:
Over the last week someone regularly dumps rubbish here, first there were mattresses, then furnitures, now there are clothes thrown out at the same spot. Unsightly, smelly, tripping hazard. Please investigate and arrange cleanup. Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cavendish Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag (Estates)

item.title: About 3 metres passed traffic lights, 7th January
item.description:
I am reporting a dangerous loose pavement slab which has been unsafe for several months. On Wednesday 31 December 2025, I tripped on this loose slab and fell, sustaining injuries. I injured my hand, which has not improved, and I also sustained a visible bruise to my left knee. I attended hospital following the incident; however, due to extreme overcrowding, I am now being assessed by my GP, who is arranging referral to an X-ray clinic. The pavement slab has been loose from the ground on and off for over six months and presents a clear trip hazard to pedestrians. Please confirm this report has been logged, provide a reference number, and arrange for inspection and urgent repair to prevent further injuries.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Agar Grove, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
